Trump: s plan taxes income through a business partnership, including hedge funds, at a rate of no more than 15 percent, lower than the previous rate of 23.8 percent.
Under Trump: s plan, income from carried interest would no longer be treated as capital gains, resulting in a higher tax rate for hedge fund managers.
The nonpartisan Tax Policy Center: s analysis confirms that eliminating the carried interest loophole actually benefits hedge fund managers under Trump's tax plan.
